Articles.Content:
As part of preparations for interplanetary crewed spaceflight, the decision was made to send a re-useable space station on a test flight into solar orbit. A team of scientists prepared to perform vital medical research on the effects of deep space travel on the crew. Flight engineers accompanied them to ensure that the station's vital systems were kept in working order.

The launch tested the limits of the Kerbooster launch vehicle.

Crew morale was often strained during the voyage. Many crewmembers felt overwhelmed by the vastness of space.

A recreational EVA helped to raise the spirits of the crew.

Much was learned about the effects of long duration space travel on the crew. Development is now proceeding on an improved space station that doesn't tip over after landing.
